description:
Myiozetetes cayanensis, commonly known as the Rusty-margined Flycatcher, is a species of bird in the family Tyrannidae. It is native to South America, with a range spanning from Colombia and Venezuela down to northern Argentina.

This flycatcher is a small bird, typically measuring around 14-16 cm in length. It has a grayish-brown head, back, and wings, with a distinctive rusty-colored margin along the wings and tail. The underparts are white, with a faint yellowish wash on the belly and undertail coverts.

Myiozetetes cayanensis is a versatile forager, feeding on a variety of insects and small invertebrates. It is often seen perching on vegetation, sallying out to catch prey in the air or gleaning from foliage. The species is known for its lively and vocal behavior, with a distinctive call that has been described as a series of high-pitched, whistling notes.

This flycatcher is commonly found in a range of habitats, including tropical and subtropical forests, woodlands, and semi-open areas. It is considered a relatively common and adaptable species within its distribution range.
